reviews.text: I am a single female tourist who booked this on the internet after reading it was in old Izmir amid elegant shops, within easy walk of shops etc. The truth is it certainly is in very old, grubby IZMIR on a noisy street with nothing to see and no where to eat in the local vicinity although it is right next to a supermarket. The staff barely spoke English but tried to be helpful and there was only a street map available- not one brochure, tour guides, tourist information of any sort. I was given the name of a tour operator who offered only "personall" tours at $250 US as there "are no tours in Izmir at this time"!! I got in taxi to the Hliton hotel and made bookings from there for daily tours to Ephesus /Pergamonfor only 65 euro!!!The rooms were tidy and there was a table and 2 chairs but the single beds were vv hard. The fridge was barely cold and so bar lukewarm and no good for keeping own drinks in. The windows were double glazed and noise hardly discernible and the aircon was fine .There is a nice lobby and a hamman which I didn't try and a nice bar but v basic, expensive dining room which I used one night. Seemed to be lots of turkish people staying there, some tour groups but really very few tourists like me.
reviews.title: Aksan no stars

reviews.text: The breakfast was buffet style and very wide and good selection .Taxi to the Hilton and waterfront was only 3.5 lira but the walk from the elegant shops and waterfront was a good 40 min!!I was in a room next to the lift which was vv noisy though I always travel with earplugs to sleep. There was no shuttle bus from the airport though one can be taken from the EfesTaxi for 10 lira. It was an OK hotel and I felt safe but really in poorpart of town
reviews.title: A below average hotel.

reviews.text: Three female guests. We thought the rooms were fine, and the staff were very helpful. The roof top bar is lovely and they opened it just for us.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, shame about the location

reviews.text: BUT we did not like the location. It isn't really far from the shops and sights, and is quite close to the culturpark, but the street is very scruffy. It is a bit seedy until you get past the railway station. Taxis are cheap so it wasn't a major problem for a one night stay, but we would definitely stay in a more elegant neighbourhood next time.
reviews.title: DO NOT BOOK! Waiters gawked at my cleavage and shared joke with customers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please note that several hotel listing sites suggest that this hotel has a swimming pool (one of the reasons we chose it). It does NOT have a pool.
reviews.title: Dont go to this hotel
not as good as it looks like
reviews.text: To me the fact that at dinner apparently the slightest amount of cleavage caused the waiters to walk by repeatedly and share the joke with the table behind us is the reason I caution all travelers not to stay here. Others might want to avoid this hotel because it is not up to date in its decor and that it's in an incredibly grubby area. If you do stay in this part of Izmir, I caution all women to wear very modest apparel because even long shorts and a t-shirt will be gawked at by every single man on the street. Perhaps this is true throughout Izmir -- we chose not to explore after this experience unlike te rest of our time in this country. The only women we saw nearby belonged to the strip clubs down the street. Again, DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL. Oh yeah, and the air conditioner was weak.

Unfortunately i booked a room from this hotel. They cancelled it out of their own. They said they called me to check if i will check in or not though "i WARNED them i will come for sure" because i knew i would arrive late. Because i was in a noisy place i couldnt hear the phone so at night when i visited them, they said they cancelled it. Thanks a lot!
